ORIGIN: Lateral epicondyle of humerus, radial collateral and annular ligaments, supinator fossa and crest of ulna
INSERTION: Supinates forearm (i.e., rotates radius to turn palm anteriorly)
ACTION: Deep branch of radial nerve (C5 and C6) (C5, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral, posterior and anterior surfaces of proximal 1/3 of radius

ORIGIN: Medial epicondyle of humerus and coronoid process of ulna
INSERTION: Pronates and flexes forearm (at elbow)
ACTION: Median nerve (C6 and C7) (C6, C7)
INNERVATION: Ulnar artery, anterior recurrent ulnar artery
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Middle of lateral surface of radius

ORIGIN: Posterior surface of ulna and interosseous membrane
INSERTION: Extends 2nd digit and helps to extend hand
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Extensor expansion of 2nd digit

ORIGIN: Tip of coracoid process of scapula
INSERTION: Helps to flex and adduct arm
ACTION: Musculocutaneous nerve (C5, C6 and C7) (C5, C6, C7)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Middle third of medial surface of humerus

ORIGIN: Oblique head: bases of 2nd and 3rd metacarpals, capitate, and adjacent carpals; Transverse head: anterior surface of body of 3rd metacarpal
INSERTION: Draws 1st metacarpal laterally to oppose thumb toward center of palm and rotates it medially
ACTION: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of thumb

ORIGIN: Hook of hamate and flexor retinaculum
INSERTION: Draws 5th metacarpal anteriorly and rotates it, bringing little finger (5th digit) into opposition with thumb
ACTION: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial border of 5th metacarpal

ORIGIN: Lateral epicondyle of humerus
INSERTION: Extends 5th digit at metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Extensor expansion of 5th digit

ORIGIN: Palmar 1 - 3: Palmar surfaces of 2nd, 4th and 5th metacarpals (unipennate muscles)
INSERTION: Palmar 1 - 3: Adduct digits toward axial line and assist lumbricals in flexing metacarpophalangeal joints and extending interphalangeal joints
ACTION: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Palmar 1 - 3: Extensor expansions of digits and bases of proximal phalanges of digits 2, 4 and 5

ORIGIN: Posterior surfaces of ulna, radius and interosseous membrane
INSERTION: Abducts thumb and extends it at carpometacarpal joint
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of 1st metacarpal

ORIGIN: Distal half of anterior surface of humerus
INSERTION: Major flexor of forearm -- flexes forearm in all positions
ACTION: Musculocutaneous nerve (C5 and C6) (C5, C6)
INNERVATION: Muscular branches of brachial artery, recurrent radial artery
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Coronoid process and tuberosity of ulna

ORIGIN: Medial epicondyle of humerus
INSERTION: Flexes hand (at wrist) and tightens palmar aponeurosis
ACTION: Median nerve (C7 and C8) (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Distal half of flexor retinaculum and palmar aponeurosis

ORIGIN: Proximal 2/3 of lateral supracondyle ridge of humerus
INSERTION: Flexes forearm
ACTION: Radial nerve (C5, C6 and C7) (C5, C6, C7)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral surface of distal end of radius

ORIGIN: Medial epicondyle of humerus
INSERTION: Flexes and abducts hand (at wrist)
ACTION: Median nerve (C6 and C7) (C6, C7)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of 2nd metacarpal

ORIGIN: Superior part of lateral border of scapula
INSERTION: Laterally rotate arm; helps to hold humeral head in glenoid cavity of scapula
ACTION: Axillary nerve (C5 and C6) (C5, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Inferior facet on greater tuberosity of humerus

ORIGIN: Hook of hamate and flexor retinaculum
INSERTION: Flexes proximal phalanx of little (5th) finger
ACTION: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of little finger

ORIGIN: Humeral head: medial epicondyle of humerus; Ulnar head: olecranon and posterior border of ulna
INSERTION: Flexes and adducts hand (at wrist)
ACTION: Ulnar nerve (C7 and C8) (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Pisiform bone, hook of hamate bone, and 5th metacarpal bone

ORIGIN: Distal 1/4 of anterior surface of ulna
INSERTION: Pronates forearm; deep fibers bind radius and ulna together
ACTION: Anterior interosseous nerve from median nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Distal 1/4 of anterior surface of radius

ORIGIN: Flexor retinaculum and tubercles of scaphoid and trapezium
INSERTION: Draws 1st metacarpal laterally to oppose thumb toward center of palm and rotates it medially
ACTION: Recurrent branch of median nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
INNERVATION: Superficial palmar branch of the radial artery
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral side of 1st metacarpal

ORIGIN: Lateral epicondyle of humerus
INSERTION: Extends medial four digits at metacarpophalangeal joints; Extends hand at wrist joint
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
INNERVATION: Interosseous recurrent and posterior interosseous arteries
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Extensor expansions of medial four digits

ORIGIN: Posterior surface of middle 1/3 of ulna and interosseous membrane
INSERTION: Extends distal phalanx of thumb at carpometacarpal and interphalangeal joints
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of distal phalanx of thumb

ORIGIN: Short head: tip of coracoid process of scapula; Long head: supraglenoid tubercle of scapula
INSERTION: Supinates forearm and, when it is supine, flexes forearm
ACTION: Musculocutaneous nerve (C5 and C6 ) (C5, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Tuberosity of radius and fascia of forearm via bicipital aponeurosis

ORIGIN: Medial third of superior nuchal line; external occipital protruberance, nuchal ligament, and spinous processes of C7 - T12 vertebrae
INSERTION: Elevates, retracts and rotates scapula; superior fibers elevate, middle fibers retract, and inferior fibers depress scapula; superior and inferior fibers act together in superior rotation of scapula
ACTION: Spinal root of accessory nerve (CN XI) (motor) and cervical nerves (C3 and C4) (pain and proprioception) (XI, C3, C4)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral third of clavicle, acromion, and spine of scapula

ORIGIN: Lateral third of clavicle, acromion, and spine of scapula
INSERTION: Anterior part: flexes and medially rotates arm; Middle part: abducts arm; Posterior part: extends and laterally rotates arm
ACTION: Axillary nerve (C5 and C6) (C5, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Deltoid tuberosity of humerus

ORIGIN: Lateral epicondyle of humerus and posterior border of ulna
INSERTION: Extends and adducts hand at wrist joint
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of 5th metacarpal

ORIGIN: Posterior surfaces of radius and interosseous membrane
INSERTION: Extends proximal phalanx of thumb at carpometacarpal joint
ACTION: Posterior interosseous nerve (C7 and C8), the continuation of the deep branch of the radial nerve (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of proximal phalanx of thumb

ORIGIN: Lateral epicondyle of humerus
INSERTION: Extend and abduct hand at wrist joint
ACTION: Deep branch of radial nerve (C7 and C8) (C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of 3rd metacarpal

ORIGIN: Superolateral surfaces of upper 8 or 9 ribs at the side of chest
INSERTION: Draws scapula forward and upward; abducts scapula and rotates it; stabilizes vertebral border of scapula
ACTION: Long thoracic nerve (C5, C6, C7) (C5, C6, C7)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Vertebral border of scapula

ORIGIN: Minor: nuchal ligament and spinous processes of C7 and T1 vertebrae; Major: spinous processes of T2 - T5 vertebrae
INSERTION: Retract scapula and rotate it to depress glenoid cavity; fix scapula to thoracic wall
ACTION: Dorsal scapular nerve ( C4 and C5) (C4, C5)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial border of scapula from level of spine to inferior angle

ORIGIN: Flexor retinaculum and tubercles of scaphoid and trapezium
INSERTION: Flexes thumb
ACTION: Recurrent branch of median nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
INNERVATION: Superficial palmar branch of the radial artery
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of thumb

ORIGIN: Dorsal 1 - 4: Adjacent sides of two metacarpals (bipennate muscles)
INSERTION: Dorsal 1 - 4: Abduct digits from axial line and act with lumbricals to flex metacarpophalangeal joints and extend interphalangeal joints
ACTION: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
INNERVATION: Dorsal 1 - 4: Dorsal and palmar metacarpal arteries
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Dorsal 1 - 4: Extensor expansions and bases of proximal phalanges of digits 2 - 4

ORIGIN: Anterior surface of radius and adjacent interosseous membrane
INSERTION: Flexes phalanges of 1st digit (thumb)
ACTION: Anterior interosseous nerve from median nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of distal phalanx of thumb

ORIGIN: Infraspinous fossa of scapula
INSERTION: Laterally rotate arm; helps to hold humeral head in glenoid cavity of scapula
ACTION: Suprascapular nerve (C5 and C6) (C5, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Middle facet on greater tuberosity of humerus

ORIGIN: Humeroulnar head: medial epicondyle of humerus, ulnar collateral ligament, and coronoid process of ulna; Radial head: superior half of anterior border of radius
INSERTION: Flexes middle phalanges at proximal interphalangeal joints of medial four digits;  acting more strongly, it also flexes proximal phalanges at metacarpophalangeal joints and hand
ACTION: Median nerve (C7, C8 and T1) (C7, C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Bodies of middle phalanges of digits 2 - 5

ORIGIN: Subscapular fossa of scapula
INSERTION: Medially rotates arm and adducts it; helps to hold humeral head in glenoid cavity of scapula
ACTION: Upper and lower subscapular nerves (C5, C6 and C7) (C5, C6, C7)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lesser tuberosity of humerus

ORIGIN: Spinous processes of inferior 6 thoracic vertebrae, thoracolumbar fascia, iliac crest, and inferior 3 or 4 ribs
INSERTION: Extends, adducts, and medially rotates humerus; raises body toward arms during climbing
ACTION: Thoracodorsal nerve (C6, C7, and C8) (C6, C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Floor of intertubercular groove of humerus

ORIGIN: Supraspinous fossa of scapula
INSERTION: Initiates and assists deltoid in abduction of arm and acts with other rotator cuff muscles
ACTION: Suprascapular nerve (C4, C5 and C6) (C4, C5, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Superior facet on greater tuberosity of humerus

ORIGIN: Posterior tubercles of transverse processes of C1 - C4 vertebrae
INSERTION: Elevates scapula and tilts its glenoid cavity inferiorly by rotating scapula
ACTION: Dorsal scapular (C5) and cervical (C3 and C4) nerves (C3, C5, C4)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Superior part of medial border of scapula

ORIGIN: Clavicular head: anterior surface of medial half of clavicle; Sternocostal head: anterior surface of sternum, superior six costal cartilages, and aponeurosis of external oblique muscle
INSERTION: Adducts and medially rotates humerus; draws scapula anteriorly and inferiorly; Acting alone: clavicular head flexes humerus and sternocostal head extends it
ACTION: Lateral and medial pectoral nerves; clavicular head (C5 and C6, sternocostal head (C7, C8, and T1) (C5, C6, C7, C8, T1)
INNERVATION: pectoral branch of the thoracoacromial trunk
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral lip of intertubercular groove of humerus

ORIGIN: Lateral supracondyle ridge of humerus
INSERTION: Extend and abduct hand at wrist joint
ACTION: Radial nerve (C6 and C7) (C7, C6)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of 2nd metacarpal

ORIGIN: Pisiform
INSERTION: Abducts little (5th) finger
ACTION: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of little finger

ORIGIN: Lateral epicondyle of humerus
INSERTION: Assists triceps in extending forearm; stabilizes elbow joint; abducts ulna during pronation
ACTION: Radial nerve (C7, C8 and T1) (C7, C8, T1)
INNERVATION: Middle collateral branch of deep brachial artery; Recurrent interosseous artery
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral surface of olecranon and superior part of posterior surface of ulna

ORIGIN: Proximal 3/4 of medial and anterior surfaces of ulna and interosseous membrane
INSERTION: Flexes distal phalanges at distal interphalangeal joints of medial four digits; assists with flexion of hand
ACTION: Medial part: ulnar nerve (C8 and T1); Lateral part: anterior interosseous branch of median nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Base of the distal phalanx of digits 2 - 5

ORIGIN: Long head: infraglenoid tubercle of scapula; Lateral head: posterior surface of humerus, superior to radial groove; Medial head: posterior surface of humerus, inferior to radial groove
INSERTION: Chief extensor of forearm; long head steadies head of abducted humerus
ACTION: Radial nerve (C6, C7 and C8) (C6, C7, C8)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Proximal end of olecranon process of ulna and fascia of forearm

ORIGIN: Dorsal surface of inferior angle of scapula
INSERTION: Adducts and medially rotates arm
ACTION: Lower subscapular nerve (C6 and C7) (C6, C7)
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial lip of intertubercular groove of humerus

ORIGIN: 3rd to 5th ribs near their costal cartilages
INSERTION: Stabilizes scapula by drawing it inferiorly and anteriorly against thoracic wall
ACTION: Medial pectoral nerves; clavicular head (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
INNERVATION: Pectoral branch of the thoracoacromial trunk
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Medial border and superior surface of coracoid process of scapula

ORIGIN: Flexor retinaculum and tubercles of scaphoid and trapezium
INSERTION: Abducts thumb and helps oppose it
ACTION: Recurrent branch of median nerve (C8 and T1) (C8, T1)
INNERVATION: Superficial palmar branch of the radial artery
ARTERIAL SUPPLY: Lateral side of base of proximal phalanx of thumb
